description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cq64a","text":"'This protocol is best used when preparing macrofungal specimens for Sanger sequencing or as a secondary extraction protocol for ONT nanopore barcoding. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2u60","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjdl2","text":"The quality of a DNA extraction method is a primary limiting factor in the total number of samples that will return a result with nanopore barcoding of fungi. The \"quick\" extraction protocol will often yield a positive result for 80-85% of general fungal collections. Utilizing this extraction protocol pushes that number to nearly 100%. It is more time consuming and utilizes more expensive chemicals, but may be worth considering for important specimens that fail with the quick extraction protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fvt5u","text":"Add 600uL of   to 1.5mL eppi tubes. One tube for each specimen you are planning an extraction for.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fs8pc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":42522,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Nuclei Lysis Solution, 1000ml","linfor":"","url":"","sku":"A7943","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"0CC7FB304BC011EDAAAD15F8DFB5C973","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":23,"name":"Promega","link":"http://www.promega.com","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agnnb","text":"Place tissue from your specimens into each tube using tweezers. Utilize a piece about the size of a grain of rice. The tissue can be either fresh or dried. Label the tube with the appropriate number. Wipe the tweezers off with a Kimwipe or paper towel in between each specimen. These tubes can be stored at room temperature until they are ready to be used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"65c9n","text":"Grind the tissue in each tube using a sterile pestle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evbqe","text":"Transfer the supernatant (liquid on top) to a new 1.5mL eppi tube.
